definition: to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition

sentences.english: The president dispatched a messenger to tell the premier what happened.
sentences.chinese: 总统派出一名信使向首相禀报所发生的事。

sentences.english: "I've a further report to make, " I said, "and a pretty long one.
sentences.chinese: “还有一事禀报，”我说，“这可就说来话长了。

sentences.english: A messenger was immediately dispatched to acquaint the Prince with what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 大家立即派人把发生的事禀报太子。

sentences.english: The Emperor was pleased by what the Minister told him about the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 听了大臣关于布料的禀报，皇帝非常高兴。

definition: to report back to one's superior
to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to submit a report to the king/to talk to the king
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
